AD_AlertingYapping.synopsis: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.

AD_Growling.synopsis: After hyena sees the player and growls before running away to call gnolls to attack.

AD_CallingHowl.synopsis: After hyena sees the player, it runs to the nearby pack of gnolls and howls to get their attention.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: From the session descriptions, AD_AlertingYapping is triggered immediately after the hyena sees the player and occurs before any further actions such as running, growling, or calling for gnolls. Both AD_Growling and AD_CallingHowl are triggered after the hyena sees the player, but each represents a distinct alternative behavior—the hyena either growls before running away (AD_Growling) or runs off to the pack and howls (AD_CallingHowl). Thus, AD_AlertingYapping must precede both AD_Growling and AD_CallingHowl. Moreover, since they represent alternative behaviors, AD_Growling and AD_CallingHowl are mutually exclusive; the hyena will perform one or the other in a given encounter.
